title: CityUHK Council Chairman leads delegation to the Middle East and Central Asia to strengthen higher education and research collaboration
description: A high-level delegation from CityUHK, led by Council Chairman Mr Michael Ngai, along with Secretary to the Council and Vice-President (Talent and International Strategy, visited Kuwait and Kazakhstan from 13 to 17 May to explore strategic partnerships in higher education and research with countries along the Belt and Road Initiative.

title: HK Tech 300 Expo showcases hundreds of CityUHK incubated start-up innovations and achievements
description: The HK Tech 300 Expo was held from 23 to 24 May, bringing together about 300 start-ups incubated by CityUHK with more than 60 roadshows, demonstrating how the University’s world-class research achievements and innovative ideas translate into practical applications that foster positive social changes.

title: Professor Paws bring joy back to CityUHK community
description: CityUHK recently welcomed back the much-loved ‘Professor Paw’, attracting over a thousand students who participated enthusiastically, bringing them smiles and stress relief.

title: CityUHK launches “Tunnel of Future Innovations”; Immersive new landmark connects campus and community with global perspectives
description: The launch of the “Tunnel of Future Innovations” on 21 May was marked by Hong Kong’s first-ever tunnel fashion show, featuring interactive digital experiences. This initiative bridges local roots with global reach, showcasing Hong Kong’s creative flair and cultural vibrancy as an international tourism hub.

title: Enhancing food security through AI: a CityUHK innovation
description: Professor Wang Jianping, Dean of the College of Computing, and her team at CityUHK discussed the integration of generative artificial intelligence in enhancing APEC’s Asia-Pacific Information Platform on Food Security at the APEC forum in Gyeongju, South Korea.

title: Pro-Chancellor Chung reappointed at City University of Hong Kong
description: Dr Chung Shui-ming, GBS, JP, has been reappointed as Pro-Chancellor of CityUHK for a further three-year term, effective from 1 August 2025.  Dr Chung’s reappointment affirms CityUHK’s immense confidence in his leadership and vision as the University continues to cement its position as a leading global institution.
